abstract: New York Public Library’s report on how many books it contains creates doubt about figure’s accuracy; members of Committee to Save the New York Public Library argue organization’s March total of 2.5 million is lower than stack capacity, and fear volumes removed for shelving update plan were not included because library is not planning to re-stack them after project’s completion.
lead_paragraph: Estimates for the capacity of the old shelves at the library have ranged widely, and critics are skeptical of a new 2.5 million figure.

headline.main: A Slippery Number: How Many Books Can Fit in the New York Public Library?
headline.print_headline: How Many Books in the Library? It Seems to Be Anybody’s Guess

snippet: Estimates for the capacity of the old shelves at the library have ranged widely, and critics are skeptical of a new 2.5 million figure.

keywords.value: Committee to Save the New York Public Library
keywords.name: organizations
